intro: Spermacoce neesiana, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with opposite, ovate leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Spermacoce neesiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along streambanks.
